Description:
It scrapes the CRAN incoming FTP folder to find where each
submission is.

Title: rOpenSci's blog guidance
Authors@R:
c(
person("Maëlle", "Salmon", , "maelle.salmon@yahoo.se", role = c("aut", "cre"),
comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0002-2815-0399")),

person("rOpenSci", role = "fnd",
comment = c("https://ropensci.org/", ROR = "019jywm96")),
person("Amanda", "Dobbyn", , "amanda.e.dobbyn@gmail.com", role = "ctb"),
person("Christophe", "Dervieux", role = "ctb"),
person("Romain", "LESUR", role = "ctb")

Description:
It provides templates for roweb2 blogging and help for a
GitHub forking workflow.
Config/pak/sysreqs:
git make libgit2-dev libicu-dev libxml2-dev
libssl-dev libx11-dev
Author:
Maëlle Salmon [aut, cre] (ORCID:
<https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2815-0399>),
Stefanie Butland [aut],
rOpenSci [fnd] (https://ropensci.org/, ROR:
<https://ror.org/019jywm96>),
Amanda Dobbyn [ctb],
Christophe Dervieux [ctb],
Romain LESUR [ctb]

Title: glitter makes SPARQL
Authors@R:
c(
person("Lise", "Vaudor", , "lise.vaudor@ens-lyon.fr", role = c("aut", "cre"),
comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0003-1844-6425")),
person("Maëlle", "Salmon", , "msmaellesalmon@gmail.com", role = "aut",
comment = c(ORCID = "0000-0002-2815-0399"))
)
Description:
This package aims at writing and sending SPARQL queries.
It makes the exploration and use of Linked Open Data (Wikidata
in particular) easier for those who do not know SPARQL.
Config/Needs/website:
DT, ggplot2, leaflet, lvaudor/sequins, sf, tidyr,
WikidataR
Author:
Lise Vaudor [aut, cre] (ORCID: <https://orcid.org/0000-0003-1844-6425>),
Maëlle Salmon [aut] (ORCID: <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-2815-0399>)

_help.title: Correspondence between R-DSL functions and SPARQL functions/operators.
SPARQL escaping.
Add a triple pattern statement to a query
Arrange results by variable value
Assemble query parts into a proper SPARQL query
Create the request control object for 'spq_init()'
Create the endpoint info object for 'spq_init()'
Filters results by adding conditions
Group the results by one or more variables
Return the first lines of results
Initialize a query object.
Label variables
Create and modify variables in the results
Offset the first generated result
Assemble query parts into a sparql query and send it to endpoint to get a tibble as a result.
Add prefixes to the query
Select (and create) particular variables
Set helper values for the query
Summarise each group of results to fewer results
Count the observations
Usual endpoints: this dataset allows the user to refer to them using a simplified name rather than their full url.
Usual prefixes: this dataset allows the user to refer to usual prefixes in their queries without manually specifying the associated urls.
